intro: Sessilistigma, commonly known as the "butterfly orchid," is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, with petals that resemble butterfly wings. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in tropical and subtropical regions. Its flowers are usually small, colorful, and fragrant, attracting specific pollinators. Sessilistigma thrives in humid environments and requires well-draining, nutrient-rich substrates for optimal growth.
